tool.name: Safely Reopen Fasta
tool.command:
python $__tool_directory__/safe_reopen.py @SEQUENCE@ #for gff in $gff3_files: $gff #end for
#if str($position.reopen_select) == "manual": --position $position.position --strand $position.strand #end if
> $output

param.label: Position Hint
param.name: position
param.help: Hint to the tool at where you would like the genome reopened upstream of. If the default value (-1) is used, then the tool will open at the first available gap. However, if a position is supplied, the tool will re-open at the first open gap upstream of the specified position. E.g. if you know where rIIa is your T4-like phage, you can supply the first base of that, and this tool will open at the first intergenic region upstream.

tool.help:
**What it does**
Given a set of gene calls and a fasta sequence, try and re-open that fasta sequence in between genes. Given that no genome annotation software really expects a randomly permuted genome, this can lead to issues when genes "wrap around" the end of the genome.
Thus we can avoid that issue completely if we have a preliminary step wherein we reopen the sequence in between putative gene calls.
**Parameters**
There are two special values of "Position Hint":
- -1 will find the first open gap downstream - -2 will find the first open gap upstream
